etymology.description: Ideogrammic: 㚔 (“criminal/handcuffs”) + 丮 (“hand”); also phono-semantic (OC *tjib): phonetic 㚔 + semantic 丮. In the present form, 㚔 → 幸 and 丮 → 丸.
etymology.interpretation: Combines the notion of a hand restraining a criminal, yielding senses like “to grasp, seize,” and by extension “to carry out/execute.” Later substitutions (幸 and 丸) streamlined the graph while preserving the idea of a hand acting upon something.
etymology.simplification: Mainland simplification reduced 執 by using the hand radical 扌 and simplifying the right-side complex (幸 + 丸) to a compact form with 丸, cutting strokes while keeping the ‘hand + object/action’ cue.

examples.chinese: 他执笔写字(他執筆寫字)。
examples.english: He holds a pen to write.

examples.chinese: 警方执行任务(警方執行任務)。
examples.english: The police carry out a mission.

examples.chinese: 法院严格执行法律(法院嚴格執行法律)。
examples.english: The court strictly enforces the law.
